description: Indicates the number of times garbage collection started to release dead objects from memory during the last measurement period.
interpretation: This shows how frequently the JVM triggered garbage collection in the last interval; more frequent collections can indicate higher allocation/turnover of objects and may impact application pause times if excessive.

description: Indicates the time taken to perform the current garbage collection operation.
interpretation: This is the duration of a garbage collection cycle. Ideally this should be low because the application is typically paused or partially paused during GC; longer GC times mean longer pauses before normal processing can resume.

measurement: Percent of time spent by JVM for garbage collection
description: Indicates the percentage of time spent by JVM in garbage collection during the last measurement period.
interpretation: This expresses how much of the JVMâ€™s time in the last period was consumed by garbage collection. Lower values are preferred; a high or rising percentage suggests GC overhead is significantly affecting overall application performance.
